result.execSummary:
The defendant Ivan J Galan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  To make regular monthly payments.  To serve 30 days in HOC, consecutive for failure to pay.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving three (3) years of Initial Confinement of today's date.
***ORDER VACATING CREDIT, dated  April 3, 2015, Judge Fiorenza/JOC to reflect ZERO days credit on counts one and three.***
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three and consecutive to any other sentence.  ***ORDER VACATING CREDIT, dated  April 3, 2015, Judge Fiorenza/JOC to reflect ZERO days credit on counts one and three.***

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment, full time school,  or in a job training program as referred by agent. Any combination is okay.
Complete a mental health evaluation.   Comply with any recommended treatment.

No alcohol.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No association with known drug users or dealers.  No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolue sobriety.  Random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Shall be tested twice per month for the first year, then  be tested once per month randomly.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised:  defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

***ORDER VACATING CREDIT, dated  April 3, 2015, Judge Fiorenza/JOC to reflect ZERO days credit on counts one and three.***
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, and consecutive to any other sentence.  ***ORDER VACATING CREDIT, dated  April 3, 2015, Judge Fiorenza/JOC to reflect ZERO days credit on counts one and three.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ivan J Galan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Request for Relief received and filed.  Copies mailed to defendant and the State./ds
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se response to amendment of judgment and request for relief.
VACATING, credit.  Order signed and filed.  Copy sent to parties.  aw
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review. jbs
Letter from DOC seeking review of duplicate sentence credit.
Original Transcript PLEA AND SENTENCE HEARING  (66 pages) commencing AUGUST 29, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Ivan J Galan in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Defendant Ivan J Galan in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count 2 dismissed, and read in for sentencing.  


AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 3, and CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 99 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS  ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program, AFTER SERVING 3 YEARS OF INTIAL CONFINEMENT OF TODAY'S DATE. 

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, and CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 99 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 


AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:
The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests, and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- Seek and maintain full time employment, full time school, or in a job training program as referred by agent.  Any combination is okay.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the HOC, consecutive for failure to pay.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw

Attorney Richard J. Smith in court, defendant Ivan J Galan not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/29/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ivan J Galan in court with attorney Richard J Smith.  Defendant Ivan J Galan in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:John Schott-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ivan J Galan in court with attorney Richard J Smith.  Defendant Ivan J Galan in custody.  Jeremy R Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/9/14 @ 1:30pm
